transcribedText: What I want to do today, since this is Build as a Startup School, is share with you some lessons I've learned about building startups at AI Fund. AI Fund is a venture studio, and we build an average of about one startup per month. And because we co-found the startups, we're in there writing code, talking to customers, designing our features, determining pricing. And so we've done a lot of reps of not just watching others build startups, but actually being in the weeds, building startups with entrepreneurs. And what I want to do today is share with you some of the lessons I've learned building startups, especially around this changing AI technology and what it enables. And we focus on the theme of speed. So it turns out that for those of you that want to build a startup, I think a strong predictor for startups' odds of success is execution speed. And I have a lot of respect for the entrepreneurs and executives that can just do things really quickly. And new AI technology is enabling startups to go much faster. So what I hope to do is share with you some of those best practices, which are frankly changing every two to three months still, to let you get that speed that hopefully lets you have a higher odds of success. Before diving into speed, a lot of people ask me, hey, Andrew, where are the opportunities for startups? So this is what I think of as an AI stack, where at the lowest level are the semiconductor companies, then the clouds are hyperscalers built on top of that, a lot of the AI foundation model companies built on top of that, and even though a lot of PR excitement and hype has been on these technology layers, it turns out that almost by definition, the biggest opportunities have to be at the application layer, because we actually need the applications to generate even more revenue so that they can afford to pay the foundation, cloud and semiconductor technology layers. So for whatever reason, media and social media tends not to talk about the application layer as much. But for those of you thinking of building startups, almost by definition, the biggest opportunities have to be there, although of course, the opportunities are all layers of the stack. One of the things that's changed a lot over the last year, and in terms of AI tech trends, if you ask me what's the most important tech trend in AI, I would say is the rise of agentic AI. And about a year and a half ago, when I started to go around and give talks to try to convince people that AI agents might be a thing, I did not realize that around last summer, a bunch of marketers would get a hold of this term and use it as a sticker and slap it on everything in sight, which made it almost lose some of its meaning. But I want to share with you from a technical perspective, why I think agentic AI is exciting and important and also opens up a lot more startup opportunities. So it turns out that the way a lot of us use OMs is to prompt it, to have it generate output. And the way we have an OOM output something is as if you're going to a human or in this case an AI and asking it to please type out an essay for you by writing from the first word...

slides.title: Introduction to Startup Building
slides.content: Today's presentation will focus on lessons learned from building startups at AI Fund, a venture studio. We engage deeply in the startup creation process, collaborating with entrepreneurs from coding to pricing strategies.
slides.speakerNotes: Outline the purpose of the presentation: sharing insights and lessons from our hands-on experience with startups at AI Fund.

slides.title: Focus: Speed in Startup Execution
slides.content: One critical factor for a startup's success is execution speed. AI technologies are enabling faster startup processes, improving odds of success.
slides.speakerNotes: Emphasize the significance of speed and how new AI technologies are pivotal in enhancing this aspect. Provide examples of how speed has impacted success.

slides.title: Opportunities in the AI Stack
slides.content: The AI stack consists of layers: semiconductors, clouds, AI models, and the application layer. The application layer holds the most significant opportunities for startups to generate revenue.
slides.speakerNotes: Discuss the AI stack in detail. Highlight the often-overlooked application layer as a key area for startup opportunities.

slides.title: The Rise of Agentic AI
slides.content: Agentic AI is a major tech trend, providing exciting and important opportunities for startups. Despite the buzz, understanding its technical perspectives is crucial.
slides.speakerNotes: Explain what agentic AI is and its potential impact on startups. Mention how the marketing and hype around it has evolved.

slides.title: Utilizing Agentic AI
slides.content: Agentic AI alters how we interact with AI by enabling proactive behaviors, thus opening up new avenues for startups.
slides.speakerNotes: Describe how agentic AI contrasts with traditional AI interactions. Provide examples of how startups can leverage this to create innovative solutions.

slides.title: Conclusion and Key Takeaways
slides.content: Success in building startups requires speed, especially with AI's evolution. Focus on application layers and stay updated with AI trends like agentic AI.
slides.speakerNotes: Summarize the key lessons: the importance of execution speed, the opportunities in the application layer of the AI stack, and the rise of agentic AI.
